questions.question: What is Figma primarily used for?
questions.explanation: Figma is primarily used for UI/UX design and prototyping, allowing designers to create interfaces, collaborate in real-time, and create interactive prototypes.

questions.question: What is a component in Figma?
options: A reusable design element that can be used across multiple designs
questions.explanation: A component in Figma is a reusable design element that can be used across multiple designs, ensuring consistency and making updates easier across the entire design system.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a style guide in UI design?
options: To document design standards and ensure consistency
To list all the features of a product
questions.explanation: A style guide documents design standards including colors, typography, spacing, and components to ensure consistency across all design work and development.

questions.question: What are variants in Figma?
options: Different states or properties of a component
questions.explanation: Variants in Figma are different states or properties of a component, such as different button states (default, hover, pressed) or different sizes of the same component.

questions.question: What is the purpose of prototyping in Figma?
options: To create interactive mockups that simulate user interactions
To export designs to other tools
questions.explanation: Prototyping in Figma creates interactive mockups that simulate user interactions, allowing designers and stakeholders to test and validate design concepts before development.

questions.question: What is auto-layout in Figma?
options: A feature that automatically arranges elements in a frame
questions.explanation: Auto-layout in Figma automatically arranges elements in a frame, making it easier to create responsive designs and maintain consistent spacing between elements.

questions.question: What is the difference between a frame and a group in Figma?
options: Frames have layout properties, groups don't
Groups are for text, frames are for shapes
Frames are temporary, groups are permanent
questions.explanation: Frames have layout properties like auto-layout and can be used for responsive design, while groups are simply containers that hold elements together without layout properties.

questions.question: What is the purpose of constraints in Figma?
options: To limit the number of elements in a design
To control how elements resize and position within a frame
To restrict access to design files
questions.explanation: Constraints in Figma control how elements resize and position within a frame, ensuring elements maintain their relative positions when the frame is resized.

questions.question: What is a design system?
options: A collection of reusable components, patterns, and guidelines
questions.explanation: A design system is a collection of reusable components, patterns, and guidelines that ensure consistency across all design work and help teams work more efficiently.

questions.question: What is the benefit of using Figma's collaborative features?
options: It allows multiple people to work on the same design simultaneously
questions.explanation: Figma's collaborative features allow multiple people to work on the same design simultaneously, enabling real-time collaboration and faster iteration cycles.
